meanings.definition: The quality or state of being alienable.
meanings.sent1: Her alienability to adapt to new environments impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained the alienability of the property to the interested buyers.
meanings.sent3: The alienability of the robot to understand human emotions led to some hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: His alienability to blend in with any crowd was like a chameleon changing colors.
meanings.sent5: The alienability of the plant to thrive in harsh conditions amazed the botanist.

meanings.definition: The ability to transfer ownership or rights to another party.
meanings.sent1: The alienability of the contract made it easy to sell the business.
meanings.sent2: She was grateful for the alienability of the deed to her new home.
meanings.sent3: The alienability of the cat to claim any sunny spot in the house always made the family laugh.
meanings.sent4: His alienability to win over clients with his charm was unmatched in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The alienability of the key to unlock any door made it a valuable possession.
